content: Hotel chain **Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts** ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 香格里拉酒店) is a [multinational](/wiki/Multinational_corporation) [hospitality company](/wiki/Hospitality_company), founded in 1971 by tycoon [Robert Kuok](/wiki/Robert_Kuok) and bearing the name of [Shangri-La](/wiki/Shangri-La), a Far Eastern mythical land of contentment depicted in the 1933 novel *[Lost Horizon](/wiki/Lost_Horizon)*. It is a subsidiary of [Kerry Properties](/wiki/Kerry_Properties), the company has over 100 [luxury hotels](/wiki/Luxury_hotel) and [resorts](/wiki/Resort) with over 40,000 rooms in [Africa](/wiki/Africa), [Asia](/wiki/Asia), [Europe](/wiki/Europe), the [Middle East](/wiki/Middle_East), [North America](/wiki/North_America) and [Oceania](/wiki/Oceania). Shangri-La has 4 brands across different market segments: Shangri-La, Traders Hotels, Kerry Hotels, and Hotel Jen. The company's head office is in Kerry Centre [zh] (嘉里中心), [Quarry Bay](/wiki/Quarry_Bay), Hong Kong. The current chairman is Kuok Hui-kwong. ## History The first hotel of the luxury Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts Group was the [Shangri-La Hotel Singapore](/wiki/Shangri-La_Hotel_Singapore), opened on 23 April 1971. The name derives from the mythical place [Shangri-La](/wiki/Shangri-La), described in the 1933 novel *[Lost Horizon](/wiki/Lost_Horizon)* by British author [James Hilton](/wiki/James_Hilton_(novelist)). The Shangri-La Hotel Singapore was managed by [Westin Hotels & Resorts](/wiki/Westin_Hotels_%26_Resorts), until Shangri-La International Hotel Management Limited was founded in 1979, and management of the Singapore Shangri-La was taken back over from Westin in 1984. However, it would not be until 1991 that Shangri-La assumed control of the rest of the hotels. This hotel has also become the host to a prominent [inter-governmental security](/wiki/International_security) [conference](/wiki/Meeting) known as the [Shangri-La Dialogue](/wiki/Shangri-La_Dialogue). ## Corporate affairs ### Subsidiaries - **Shangri-La Asia Limited** is incorporated in [Bermuda](/wiki/Bermuda) with limited liability. It is primarily listed on the [Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited](/wiki/Hong_Kong_Stock_Exchange) (stock code 00069) with a secondary listing on the [Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited](/wiki/Singapore_Exchange) (stock code Shang Asia 2kHK$) and with [American Depositary Receipt](/wiki/American_Depositary_Receipt) traded as SHALY. Since 1997, Shangri-La Asia Limited has owned Shangri-La International Hotel Management Limited. - **Shangri-La Hotels (Malaysia) Berhad** is incorporated in [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) with limited liability and is traded on the [Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad](/wiki/Bursa_Malaysia) (stock code 5517). - **Shangri-La Hotel Public Company Limited** is incorporated in [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand) with limited liability and is traded on the [Stock Exchange of Thailand](/wiki/Stock_Exchange_of_Thailand) (stock code SHANG). ### Properties As of March 2022, Shangri-La owns, operates, or manages 100 hotels in 77 destinations:[*citation needed*] BrandNo. of propertiesShangri-La91Hotel Jen9Kerry Hotels3Traders2China World2**Total**107 ## Senior leadership This section **does not cite any sources**.
